title: Billing & Pricing
description: Understand AWS pricing models, cost management, and billing tools

questions.question: What is the AWS Free Tier?
options: Limited free usage of services for 12 months plus always-free services
A discount program for students only
questions.explanation: AWS Free Tier includes 12 months of free tier services, always-free services, and short-term free trials for certain services.

questions.question: What are the three AWS pricing models?
options: Pay-as-you-go, Save when you reserve, Pay less by using more
questions.explanation: AWS uses three pricing models: Pay-as-you-go (on-demand), Save when you reserve (Reserved Instances), and Pay less by using more (volume discounts).

questions.question: What is AWS Cost Explorer?
options: A tool to visualize and manage AWS costs and usage over time
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer helps you visualize, understand, and manage AWS costs and usage over time with custom reports.

questions.question: What are Reserved Instances?
options: A commitment to use EC2 for 1 or 3 years in exchange for significant discounts
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide up to 75% discount compared to On-Demand pricing in exchange for a 1 or 3-year commitment.

questions.question: What are Spot Instances?
options: Unused EC2 capacity available at up to 90% discount
questions.explanation: Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity at discounts up to 90%, but can be interrupted with 2-minute notice.

questions.question: What is AWS Budgets?
options: A tool to set custom cost and usage budgets with alerts
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets allows you to set custom budgets that alert you when costs or usage exceed (or are forecasted to exceed) your budgeted amount.

questions.question: Which service provides cost optimization recommendations?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides real-time guidance including cost optimization recommendations to help reduce costs.

questions.question: What is the AWS Pricing Calculator?
options: A tool to estimate AWS costs for your use case
questions.explanation: AWS Pricing Calculator helps you estimate costs for AWS services based on your expected usage patterns.

questions.question: What are AWS Organizations volume discounts?
options: Consolidated billing that can result in volume discounts across accounts
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows consolidated billing, pooling usage across accounts to reach volume discount tiers faster.

questions.question: What is AWS Cost and Usage Report?
options: The most comprehensive set of cost and usage data available
questions.explanation: AWS Cost and Usage Report provides the most comprehensive cost and usage data, including detailed line items and custom tags.

questions.question: What is included in the AWS Free Tier for EC2?
options: 750 hours per month of t2.micro or t3.micro instances for 12 months
One year of any instance type
EC2 is not included in Free Tier
questions.explanation: AWS Free Tier includes 750 hours per month of Linux or Windows t2.micro (or t3.micro in some regions) instances for 12 months.

questions.question: How does AWS charge for S3?
options: Based on storage used, requests made, and data transfer
questions.explanation: S3 charges based on: storage amount (GB-month), number of requests (PUT, GET), and data transfer out of S3.

questions.question: Which support plan provides a Technical Account Manager (TAM)?
questions.explanation: The Enterprise support plan includes a dedicated Technical Account Manager (TAM) who provides proactive guidance.

questions.question: What Reserved Instance term options are available?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances can be purchased for 1-year or 3-year terms, with 3-year terms providing larger discounts.

questions.question: Which tool helps you create cost estimates before deploying resources?
questions.explanation: AWS Pricing Calculator helps you estimate costs for your AWS use case before you deploy resources.

questions.question: What is a benefit of AWS consolidated billing?
options: Combined usage across accounts for potential volume discounts
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing combines usage across all accounts in an organization, helping you reach volume discount tiers faster.

questions.question: Which AWS service is always free (not time-limited)?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda includes 1 million free requests per month permanently, not limited to 12 months like some Free Tier offerings.

questions.question: How can you track costs by project or department?
questions.explanation: Resource tags allow you to categorize and track costs by project, department, environment, or any custom dimension.

questions.question: What is the minimum Enterprise Support plan cost per month?
questions.explanation: Enterprise Support starts at $15,000 per month or 3-10% of monthly AWS usage, whichever is higher.

questions.question: Which pricing model requires you to commit to a specific instance type and region?
questions.explanation: Standard Reserved Instances require commitment to instance type, region, and platform, offering the highest discount but least flexibility.

documentation:
Billing & Pricing

AWS Pricing Philosophy:

AWS pricing is based on three fundamental principles:

  1. Pay-as-you-go: Pay only for what you use, no upfront costs
  2. Save when you reserve: Get discounts by committing to usage
  3. Pay less by using more: Volume-based discounts

AWS Free Tier:

Three types of free offers:

  • 12 Months Free: Starts from sign-up date
    • EC2: 750 hours/month of t2.micro or t3.micro
    • S3: 5 GB standard storage
    • RDS: 750 hours/month of db.t2.micro
    • CloudFront: 50 GB data transfer out
  • Always Free: Never expires
    • Lambda: 1 million requests/month
    • DynamoDB: 25 GB storage
    • CloudWatch: 10 custom metrics and alarms
    • SNS: 1 million publishes
  • Trials: Short-term free usage
    • SageMaker: 2 months free
    • Inspector: 90 days free
    • Lightsail: 1 month free

EC2 Pricing Models:

  • On-Demand: Pay by the hour or second, no commitment
  • Reserved Instances (RI): 1 or 3-year commitment, up to 75% discount
    • Standard RI: Largest discount, can't change instance type
    • Convertible RI: Less discount, can change instance type
  • Savings Plans: Flexible pricing, commit to usage ($/hour) for 1 or 3 years
  • Spot Instances: Up to 90% discount, can be interrupted
  • Dedicated Hosts: Physical server dedicated to you, for compliance
  • Dedicated Instances: Instances on hardware dedicated to you

Cost Management Tools:

  • AWS Cost Explorer:
    • Visualize and analyze costs
    • View past 12 months and forecast next 12 months
    • Filter by service, region, tag, etc.
    • Identify cost trends and anomalies
  • AWS Budgets:
    • Set custom cost and usage budgets
    • Alerts when exceeding or forecasted to exceed
    • Track Reserved Instance utilization
    • Budget types: Cost, Usage, RI Utilization, RI Coverage
  • AWS Cost and Usage Report:
    • Most comprehensive cost data
    • Hourly, daily, or monthly granularity
    • Delivered to S3
    • Can be analyzed with Athena or QuickSight
  • AWS Pricing Calculator:
    • Estimate costs before provisioning
    • Configure services and view price estimates
    • Save and share estimates

AWS Organizations and Billing:

  • Consolidated Billing:
    • Single bill for multiple accounts
    • Combined usage for volume discounts
    • Free feature of AWS Organizations
    • Easy tracking of charges
  • Volume Discounts:
    • S3: Pay less per GB as usage increases
    • Data Transfer: Tiered pricing
    • Pooled usage across accounts

AWS Support Plans and Pricing:

  • Basic: Free
    • Customer Service, documentation, forums
    • AWS Trusted Advisor (7 core checks)
    • AWS Personal Health Dashboard
  • Developer: $29/month or 3% of monthly usage
    • Business hours email access to Cloud Support Associates
    • 12-24 hour response time
  • Business: $100/month or 3-10% of monthly usage
    • 24/7 phone, email, and chat support
    • Full Trusted Advisor checks
    • 1-hour response for urgent issues
  • Enterprise: $15,000/month or 3-10% of monthly usage
    • Technical Account Manager (TAM)
    • Concierge Support Team
    • 15-minute response for critical issues
    • Infrastructure Event Management

Cost Optimization Best Practices:

  1. Right-sizing: Use appropriate instance types
  2. Use Reserved Instances/Savings Plans: For predictable workloads
  3. Use Spot Instances: For fault-tolerant workloads
  4. Monitor and analyze: Use Cost Explorer and Budgets
  5. Set budgets and alerts: Prevent unexpected costs
  6. Delete unused resources: Stop idle instances, delete unused snapshots
  7. Use Auto Scaling: Scale resources based on demand
  8. Choose the right storage class: S3 Glacier for archives
  9. Use AWS Trusted Advisor: Follow cost optimization recommendations
  10. Leverage tags: Track costs by project, department, etc.

AWS Pricing Examples:

  • Amazon S3: Storage (per GB/month) + Requests (per 1,000) + Data Transfer Out
  • Amazon EC2: Instance hours + Data Transfer + EBS Storage
  • Amazon RDS: Instance hours + Storage + Backup Storage + Data Transfer
  • Lambda: Requests (per million) + Duration (per GB-second)
  • CloudFront: Data Transfer Out + HTTP/HTTPS Requests

AWS TCO (Total Cost of Ownership) Calculator:

Compare costs of running infrastructure on-premises vs AWS:

  • Server costs
  • Storage costs
  • Network costs
  • IT labor costs
  • Facility costs (power, cooling, space)
